lessons.name: Unit Testing: Part 1
lessons.description: The video conveys the value proposition of unit testing and introduces an app, RomanNumerals, that will be thoroughly unit-tested.

links.name: Unit Testing Starter Project
links.definition: This is the starter project for the unit-testing crash course.

links.name: Weather API
links.definition: This API, from OpenWeather, provides "essential weather data, short-term and long-term forecasts[,] and aggregated weather data".

keyTerms.name: CodingKey/CodingKeys
keyTerms.definition: A technique for decoding JSON into model properties whose names are not necessarily identical to key names in the JSON.

lessons.name: Unit Testing: Part 2
lessons.description: This video shows setup for unit testing, demonstrates unit testing, and introduces XCTest, Apple's testing framework.

keyTerms.name: XCTest
keyTerms.definition: Apple's unit-testing framework; has functions like XCTAssert() for verifying code behavior.

keyTerms.name: SUT
keyTerms.definition: System under test: the thing being tested by a unit test. Described by Gerard Meszaros.

lessons.name: Unit Testing: Part 3
lessons.description: This video shows how to level up unit testing with custom app delegates, custom scene delegates, and refactoring.

lessons.name: Unit Testing: Part 4
lessons.description: This video defines and describes the value propositions for dependency injection, test doubles, and dependeffects. "Dependeffects" is not a typo.

keyTerms.name: Dependeffect
keyTerms.definition: An API that has a side effect that is undesirable for unit testing, that has a dependency that complicates unit testing, or both.

keyTerms.name: Test Double
keyTerms.definition: An object that replaces a production object for testing purposes. Described and popularized by Martin Fowler and Gerard Meszaros.

keyTerms.name: Fake
keyTerms.definition: A kind of test double that has a real implementation but that takes some sort of shortcut, for example using a Dictionary rather than UserDefaults or the filesystem. Described by Martin Fowler and Gerard Meszaros.

keyTerms.name: Stub
keyTerms.definition: A kind of test double that "provide[s] canned answers to calls made during [a unit test], usually not responding at all to anything outside what's programmed in for the test." A stub URLSession could provide JSON responses without hitting an actual endpoint. Described and popularized by Martin Fowler and Gerard Meszaros.

keyTerms.name: Dummy
keyTerms.definition: A kind of test double used when the SUT doesn't care about or need a real implementation. Described and popularized by Martin Fowler and Gerard Meszaros.

keyTerms.name: Spy
keyTerms.definition: A kind of stub that also records some information based on how it was called.

keyTerms.name: Dependency Injection
keyTerms.definition: The practice of providing dependeffects to their consumers, rather than having consumers acquire or initialize their dependeffects. Often abbreviated DI.

keyTerms.name: Method Injection
keyTerms.definition: A variant of dependency injection by which dependeffects are provided to objects that need them as function arguments.

lessons.name: Unit Testing: Part 5
lessons.description: This video provides unit tests for seven additional files in RomanNumerals. Next, this video introduces three more approaches to dependency injection: property injection, The World, and frameworks. Finally, this video describes and, braving controversy, shares opinions about test-driven development.

links.name: Unit Testing Completed Project
links.definition: This is the completed project for the unit-testing crash course.

links.name: Preparing for Growth: Architecting Giant Apps for Scalability and Build Speed
links.definition: In this conference talk, Bruno Rocha described how Spotify architected its iOS app to facilitate fast compilation and dependency injection.

keyTerms.name: Property Injection
keyTerms.definition: A variant of dependency injection by which dependeffects are set for objects that need them as property values.

keyTerms.name: The World
keyTerms.definition: A globally accessible object from which dependeffects can be accessed.

keyTerms.name: Dependency-Injection Framework
keyTerms.definition: A third-party framework that provides dependency injection and often other benefits.

keyTerms.name: Test-Driven Development
keyTerms.definition: Also known as TDD, a software-development technique by which the developer writes unit tests before writing the production code it will test.

lessons.name: Unit Testing: Part 6
lessons.description: This video gives you, the viewer, an opportunity to identify dependeffects and write some unit tests. Unit testing merits further exploration, and this video provides resources.

links.name: Unit Testing Starter Bonus Project
links.definition: This is the starter bonus project for the unit-testing crash course.

links.name: Unit Testing Completed Bonus Project
links.definition: This is the completed bonus project for the unit-testing crash course.

links.name: TestDouble
links.definition: In this article, Martin Fowler described test doubles and their value proposition.

links.name: Test-Driven Development in Swift
links.definition: In this book, Gio Lodi described not only test-driven development but also unit testing in general.

links.name: How to Control the World
links.definition: In this article, Point-Free introduced The World as a means of dependency injection, though they explicitly rejected that term.

links.name: Preparing for Growth: Architecting Giant Apps for Scalability and Build Speed
links.definition: In this conference talk, Bruno Rocha described how Spotify architected its iOS app to facilitate fast compilation and dependency injection.
